subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP Files > Need some more advice from everyone, please

Hi Debbie,
 
Yes I am most certainly getting and hearing messages, respons=
es and answers in real time.
I do verbalize my sessions, I ask questions an=
d answer questions they may ask.
 
When you ask a question give at least te=
n seconds before you ask the next question.
Our friends may not be able to =
catch the correct signal or radio fragment to answer
immediatelly. Listen c=
arefully during the time after a question and if it is answered and the 
co=
nditions are optimal, such as a good signal and strong response. you should=
 hear the answer if not all 
part of it in real time.
 
most of the time we=
 miss the real time communication due to the speed of the sweep of the ammo=
unt of clutter the signal
is producing. I work with only the AM band, I fin=
d it less crowded than FM and therefore easier to catch real time responses=
.
 
The yes, no and name responses are the easiest to hear real time. The m=
ain thing is to listen carefully for any words or 
phrases that pertain to =
the question you have asked. Also when you do hear a real time communicatio=
n, immediatelly
repeat what was said. That gives varification when listenin=
g back to the recording that you did in fact hear it real time.
 
At first =
get yourself accustomed to listening for the simple yes, no answers and you=
r ear will start to develop for seperating the 
spirit communication from t=
he radio noise.
 
I hope this helps.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups.comFrom: Debbie@...: Mon, 24 Mar 2008 15:04:04 +=
0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP Files > Need some more advice from everyone,=

 time" answers or do you have to play it back to hear their answers? Just a=
sking because I need to play my recordings back to hear responses ..Debbie-=

 wrote:>> > Mike,> > I usually start with asking if they will please join m=
e in a communication session. If you have a technician and or spirits that =
communicate> with you on a regular basis, and know their names, greet them =
and thank them for their efforts in communicating and to please send any me=
ssages> or respond to any question that you have, and you will do the same.=
 Also ask that they block any negative energy or communication or spirits t=
hemselves > from coming through the box. then proceed with the session.> > =
At the end I ask that any spirits that may have come through the open doorw=
ay the line of live communication may create, go back before the box is tur=
ned off.> > wait to here verbal conformation from the other side that it is=
 clear to turn the box off. the responses I usually get are Clear, Good, Ok=
ay or words to that effect.> > I thank my friends for their efforts and say=
 my goodbyes and announce that I am turning off the box. I turn it off and =
the session is done.> > Some researchers feel comfortable as I do saying a =
short protection prayer before a session and some do not believe it is nece=
ssary. the choice is yours.> > I have posted a short protection ritual in t=
he file section of my other group, it is there if you need it.> > the link =
to the group is http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP_ITC_Researchers/ jus=
t go over and join.> > Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@...: f1crack=

 Need some more advice from everyone, please> > > > > > Hi all, and hope yo=

ince they are clips of what you are doing, my question is how do each of yo=

nyone one there?" Or do you start calling out names, or do you even pray th=

 date, or is it when you turn it on they are waiting for you?> > Also lets =

Hi Debbie,<BR>
 <BR>
Yes I am most certainly getting and h=
earing messages, responses and answers in real time.<BR>
I do verbalize my =
sessions, I ask questions and answer questions they may ask.<BR>
 <BR>=

When you ask a question give at least ten seconds before you ask the next =
question.<BR>
Our friends may not be able to catch the correct signal or ra=
dio fragment to answer<BR>
immediatelly. Listen carefully during the time a=
fter a question and if it is answered and the <BR>
conditions are optimal, =
such as a good signal and strong response. you should hear the answer if no=
t all <BR>
part of it in real time.<BR>
 <BR>
most of the time we miss=
 the real time communication due to the speed of the sweep of the ammount o=
f clutter the signal<BR>
is producing. I work with only the AM band, I find=
 it less crowded than FM and therefore easier to catch real time responses.=
<BR>
 <BR>
The yes, no and name responses are the easiest to hear real=
 time. The main thing is to listen carefully for any words or <BR>
phrases =
that pertain to the question you have asked. Also when you do hear a real t=
ime communication, immediatelly<BR>
repeat what was said. That gives varifi=
cation when listening back to the recording that you did in fact hear it re=
al time.<BR>
 <BR>
At first get yourself accustomed to listening for t=
he simple yes, no answers and your ear will start to develop for seperating=
 the <BR>
spirit communication from the radio noise.<BR>
 <BR>
I hope =
this helps.<BR>
 <BR>
Bruce<BR><BR><BR>
